popt4jlib.MonteCarlo

Class FasterDblArray1ArgMaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.MonteCarlo.FasterDblArray1ArgMaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, RandomArgMakerClonableIntf, RandomArgMakerIntf

    public class FasterDblArray1ArgMaker
extends java.lang.Object
implements RandomArgMakerClonableIntf
    creates random double[] objects of fixed length, according to parameters passed in a HashMap object. It should be faster than the FastDblArray1ArgMaker class, because it doesn't create new double[] each time the createRandomArgument(p) method is invoked, but instead re-uses a private (cache) data member. Being completely unsynchronized, the methods of an object of this class must only be called from the same thread.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2018

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public RandomArgMakerClonableIntf newInstance(java.util.HashMap params)
                                       throws OptimizerException
        creates a new instance that can be used without the need for any synchronization when invoked, as different threads own different objects. Notice that the _x (current-arg) data member, if not null, is also deep-copied into the new instance that is returned.
        Specified by:
        newInstance in interface RandomArgMakerClonableIntf
        Parameters:
        params - HashMap must contain the following params:
        • <"mcs.arglength", $integer_value$> mandatory, the length of the argument.
        • <"mcs.minargvalue", $value$> mandatory, the minimum value for any arg. element.
        • <"mcs.minargvalue$i$", $value$> optional, the minimum value for the i-th element in the argument ($i$ must be in the range {0,...,arg_length-1}. If this value is less than the global value specified by the "mcs.minargvalue" key, it is ignored.
        • <"mcs.maxargvalue", $value$> mandatory, the maximum value for any element in the argument.
        • <"mcs.maxargvalue$i$", $value$> optional, the maximum value for the i-th element in the argument ($i$ must be in the range {0,...,arg_length-1}. If this value is greater than the global value specified by the "mcs.maxargvalue" key, it is ignored.
        • <"thread.id",$integer_value"> mandatory, the (internal) id of the thread invoking this method; this number is used so as to look-up the right random-number generator associated with the current thread.
        Returns:
        FasterDblArray1ArgMaker new instance according to the params passed in
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if incorrect arguments were passed in the params argument
